basics.name: Salina Thongsisavath
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii at Mānoa. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2025. I hope to pursue a career in Software Engineering.

courses: Introduction to Computer Science I & II

highlights: Provide technical support for both hardware and software issues across the organization.
Test, debug, and provide consultation for the company’s internal intranet website.
Design and maintain forms to ensure secure data transmission and optimal user experience.
Collaborate with various departments to create efficient IT solutions to enhance organization workflows.
Assisted customers by providing information and resolving any complaints
Prepared a variety of foods and beverages according to customers
Operate restaurant's computer systems and administer payments
Collaborated with students to complete homework assignments, lagging skills, and correct weaknesses
Motivate students towards learning and studying to build strong foundation
Subjects ranged from Algebra I to Calculus I

volunteer.summary: Developed a chatbot for the University of Hawaii Information Technology Services (ITS) department to help students with common questions. Utilized UH ITS help articles for contextual understanding.
highlights: Employed Python Langchain and Meta's LLAMA2 models to independently host a local LLM Chatbot on Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
Developed the frontend utilizing Next.js, Typescript, and Tailwind CSS. PostgreSQL for the database.

volunteer.summary: PANDA is a student organization at the University of Hawaii at Manoa that is dedicated to studying and applying algorithms in programming.
highlights: Participate in weekly meetings to discuss algorithms and data structures
Practice solving algorithm problems to prepare for coding interviews
Introduce team to Flutter, Dart, and GitHub
Schedule, organize, and lead team meetings

awards.title: B+ Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to incoming freshmen and continuing students who complete a rigorous high school curriculum with a minimum overall GPA of 3.0 at a Hawai'i public school.

awards.title: Manoa Academic Merit ScholarShip
awards.summary: An automatic scholarship per year for four years of undergraduate study for first-time degree-seeking students. Students must have a 3.8 GPA.

awards.title: Dean's List
awards.summary: Recognizes students with an excellent academic record, Minimumm current grade point average of 3.5 for 12 or more credits of academic coursework.
